intro: Hypoporum variegatum, commonly known as the variegated hypoporum, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves that are often variegated with white or yellow markings. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It is native to parts of Europe and is often found in grassy areas and along roadsides. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
